Hi Alexander,

On Feb 27, 2007, at 12:17 AM, Alexander Johannesen wrote:

> On 2/27/07, Bill Venners <bv-svp@...> wrote:
>>  /articles?t=java
>>  /news?t=java
>
>    /articles/java
>    /news/java
>
> which each resolve to an item ;
>
>    /article/1234
>    /news-item/2335
>
I considered this option along the way as well, but the trouble with  
it is it breaks my desire to have something useful at each path  
segment. (Also, I want to have strings for article IDs in URLs, not  
numbers as in:

/article/why_put_and_delete

Anyway, if the user is at the above URL and chops off the / 
why_put_and_delete, they would get:

/article

And there's nothing sensible to put at that URL.

If the URL is:

/articles/why_put_and_delete

Then when they chop, they get:

/articles

Which is a listing or way to browse through all articles. I  
considered just redirecting from /article to /articles, but I felt  
that was a bit jumpy for the user. It's not terrible, but neither is  
putting the topic in a query param instead of a path segment, and I  
chose the latter.

Bill
